Fields.DialogueText: What a travesty!
What's the matter?
Can you not see this... this abomination? Frankly, I am beyond bewilderment.

Fields.MenuText: I see shelves and miscellaneous items strewn about.
I don't see what you're talking about.
Uhhhhhhhhhhh...

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly the point! What is a lady to do?
Look around you, Captain, and let it sink in.
Words, Captain. Use your words.
Get to the brass tacks, what is the situation?
My washroom is ruined! Absolutely ruined from that last battle.
It still can work as a washroom, right?
Captain! That attitude just simply won't do. How can a lady perform her best when she can't look her best? Right now, I'm like an artist who's lost their studio!
So... what do we need to do?
We must renovate the washroom, Captain, and turn it into a proper ladies' vanity. To perform our best we must look our best.
This is war. You know that, right?
Don't be fooled, Captain. Wars have been fought over the beauty of women before. Think of Helen of Troy. And any quality that is relevant in battle can be a weapon if properly honed.
I am thinking that there's likely no way I can stop you. Is there, Hood?
That's Lady Hood, Captain. For future reference, please remember to mind your manners.
@BATTLE
What's all this mess? Hood... er, Lady Hood, who are all these strange people on board?
These are the finest architects the British Empire has to offer.
Right. Why are they on the ship?
They are here to design my new vanity and powder room, Captain.
Belles have been granted a lot of leeway in cosmetic refits, and I'm basically fine with that - but this is going to cost a fortune.
There are two things a lady can never have too much of: beauty and wealth. I set my sights for the top.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't there goals you can have that would be more... practical?
How much is this going to cost?
How long are these renowned architects here for?

Fields.DialogueText: One might think so, but our aim is to dazzle the enemy with brilliance. First impressions count for everything.
Things a lady shall never reveal are her age, weight, and the cost of doing business.
Only the length of the planning and building.
Hold on a minute, Captain. Labourer... YOU, labourer! Those gowns will go into the walk-in closet. And do remember that they're masterpieces - handle them lovingly.
A walk-in closet? Things are tightly spaced as is.
Indeed, a walk-in closet with full mirrors showing every angle. There also needs to be an adequate vanity where I will store all the tricks of my trade, then...
Then?
Then, we'll see to that drab water closet. Perhaps we'll give it a matte painted seaside theme, with pairs of choughs nesting along the Cornwall cliffside.
... Choughs?
Captain, I can assure you that enhancing one's natural beauty will pay out dividends in no time.
@BATTLE
... Yeah.
Oh, drat! How dreadful.
What's wrong?
The current plans simply won't do. The look is just too old fashioned and does not capture that certain ethereal glow. Look here, this foyer...

Fields.MenuText: For a moment there, I thought something was actually wrong.
What ethereal glow is that?
There's a foyer now?

Fields.DialogueText: Something is wrong. It is a problem that must be addressed swiftly if we are to make any type of progress at all.
The essence of what defines beauty. We are moving away from those dreary darker tones into a lighter, cheerful palette of pistachio, rose and saffron.
Captain, there were always plans for a foyer. How else am I to be received in my powder room?
What are your plans for this foyer?
Perhaps a whimsical floral entrance. A scene to invigorate the senses, akin to the makeup counter when walking into Selfridge's.
*ALARM*
Well these Morganas are our priority. You can shop at Selfridge's later.
Let me see your binoculars, Captain. What are they wearing exactly? I cannot tell if they are trying to match or mask their vulgar visages.
@BATTLE
Those Morganas as quite the frightful-looking foes.
A fair assessment.
I just can't imagine going through life looking that... unpolished. Beauty is a power that should be cultivated time and time again.

Fields.MenuText: How is beauty a power?
I don't understand... how do you cultivate beauty?
Let me ask you a question - what would you say is a good shade for your eyes?

Fields.DialogueText: Surely you've noticed that popular culture teaches one to conflate virtue and influence with appearance, Captain. Me being spectacular subtly reinforces - with crew and admiralty alike - our heroism.
Put on your astute observation hat, Captain. Officer, oh, Officer! Yes, you, all the way over there!
Did you mean a highlighting eye shadow? That would be an orange-peach to a light rose. It highlights my strawberry blonde locks and fuchsia eyes.
*ALARM*
A well-polished crew, on His Majesty's finest ship in the fleet is something that everyone, even Morganas, should consider a sight to behold.
That seems like a bold statement.
Painting an impression is mostly confidence. Asserting victory over the enemy might be our objective, but looking good is half the battle, Captain.
@BATTLE
I've noticed you seem to focus your energy on beauty, Hood.
I must say, Captain, for once you have had a marginally astute observation. It is a delicate balance. I expect nothing less than the crew to wash their faces and put on their Sunday best.
First impressions count for everything, right?
Yes, Lady Hood?
Where is the nearest port?
We are not too far off, lady.
Very, well. Next time we are in port, please be a dear and purchase me the finest grog the local town has to offer.
With pleasure, Lady Hood!
See, Captain? That's how you cultivate beauty. You use your beauty so people are willing to do whatever it takes to be in your presence.
I've noticed you seem to focus your energy on beauty, Hood.
I must say, Captain, for once you have had a marginally astute observation. It is a delicate balance. I expect nothing less than the crew to wash their faces and put on their Sunday best.
First impressions count for everything, right?
And that means leverage. And, therefore, power.
*KNOCK*
HELLO? Hello!?! Who's in the head and what's taking you so long?
Calm your nerves, Captain.
Hood, why are you in my washroom?
Tsk, tsk, Captain. It is Lady Hood, if you will. I am using your water closet because mine is still under renovation.
There are other heads on board you would be welcome to use.
You honestly can't expect someone of my caliber to use some common head - can you, Captain?
I don't see why not...
Let's begin shall we? For starters, the lighting in there is nothing short of atrocious. The color produces an olive hue in my skin. I can't work with my skin looking that shade.

Fields.MenuText: Olive hue? Why can't you refer to objects using normal colors?
How does that olive hue look on your strawberry blond locks?
Yeah, but it's not as though my private head is palatial. You can't even fit all your gear in there, can you?

Fields.DialogueText: Refined color references can only reflect the taste of refined individuals, Captain.
How would you imagine? Well, best not to try to imagine, I don't want you thinking of me in any lesser state than I deserve to be.
Trust me, Captain, you don't need to highlight the deficiencies here. They're painfully apparent. But we all have to compromise once in a while.
In the future, please don't take so long. What if there was an emergency?
I suspect if it was urgent, Captain, you wouldn't be standing here quibbling with me about the allotment of time.
*ALARM*
Enjoy your water closet, Captain. I have important matters that require the lady of the ship's attention.
@BATTLE
Sound the bells, how delightful!
You seem cheerful, Lady Hood.
Look at what the builders have created - isn't it darling? These little beds for Fishcakes and Ginger. They'll be delighted at their new sleeping arrangements.

Fields.MenuText: Cats seem happy with any old box they can fit in.
They're just cats...
Those cats should be working on catching the rats.

Fields.DialogueText: I will have you note that Fishcakes and Ginger are bred from the finest stock. Aristocats such as these are only suited to sleeping on the finest down beds.
A dismissive remark. Ginger is a fine specimen of tabby and Fishcakes has a tuxedo that anyone would be proud to wear.
These are creatures of distinguished pedigree. They cannot dole in ignoble pursuits such as the destruction of vermin.
Oh, my darlings. Don't let those ill remarks work you into a fret. I'll have one of the crew members fetch you a saucer of warm milk.
I had no idea you were so... affectionate, Lady Hood.
Felines are not fully domesticated creatures. They are perfectly capable of hunting, but know that by their mere beauty they can captivate their masters to bring them their meals.
Ah. You really see them as kindred spirits, then.
I don't have to reveal my secrets to you, Captain.
*ALARM*
Stay put, my darlings.  I'll go take care of the Morganas before you wake up from your naps.
@BATTLE
Captain! Where are you?
In your presence...
Splendid, Captain! I am formally notifying you that we are headed to Italy.
What's happening? Are the Morganas pushing out from the Aegean?
Captain, the Morganas are not even a challenge to the Mighty Hood. We are headed to Italy for granite countertops.

Fields.MenuText: Let me guess. For your powder room, right?
What about Scandinavia?
What type of granite did you have in mind?

Fields.DialogueText: Right you are. Captain. Also for the water closet. Only the finest will do, my ship deserves nothing short of top notch.
If I have to see one more utilitarian Scandinavian building, I will... I will catch my death from those unflattering designs.
That depends on when we get there, but no expense can be spared.
Uh-huh. So, assuming both Command and I determine value in Mediterranean operations - which I do not guarantee...
Genoa. Oh, we'll need to get a translator!
You don't speak Italian, then? What languages do you speak?
English.
It's my understanding that Belles are at least conversationally fluent in the languages spoken by your crews. And we're fairly international at this point.
I only require one language to be effective, Captain. Indeed, I hardly even require that! I've circumnavigated the globe and you can bet your last quid that beauty transcends all languages.
If so, then why do you need a translator?
There are more important things to do, such as those Morganas out in the open water. Best to make the transaction quick - therefore, a translator is required.
*ALARM*
Right on cue. Right then, let's show them what the Mighty Hood is known for.
@BATTLE
Pff!
... what port did you have in mind?
Ah. But English is my native language. It's where I shine. I would be less extraordinary with a borrowed tongue, so I don't use them. You see?

Fields.MenuText: I suppose.
Despite myself.
No. Not at all.

Fields.DialogueText: Hood! The deck is full of giant slabs of granite!
Marvelous! The dealer is here! Officer, fetch my translator, would you? Oh, how I have missed the Mediterranean.
*meow*
Your cat is here.
Hello, Fishcakes! How wonderful for you to join me! Let's pick out our new countertops. Why don't we find something to match the hue in your eyes?
*meow*
Now Ginger, don't let the green monster have at it. You also may come along and partake in the selection. Care to join us, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I have more important things to do.
I think your cats are running out of pâté.
Why not?

Fields.DialogueText: What's more important than looking our best? Imagine the faces of all of the British Empire when we pull into port.
I must say, thank you for noticing. Be a darling and fetch some fresh pâté would you?
Brilliant! You will be the first to witness the beginnings of something great.
*ALARM*
Better make our choice fast!
Let's deal with the Bitch Fleet, then we can select the granite.
What if the granite breaks?
Then that makes it easy to see which ones aren't of the best quality.
@BATTLE
So, only one of those granite slabs survived that last fight, eh?
It's a luxurious... rosse? I think that's what the dealer said it was. Rosse.
You see, Captain - the translator wasn't even needed after all. Beauty speaks all languages.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure beauty was even used, in this instance.
The color matches Ginger's fur.
I'm afraid I didn't get the cat food.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't see how. That dealer was so taken with me that he was hardly bothered by the loss of his other granite slabs.
It does! The patterning of it is strikingly similar to his marbled tabby pattern.
Drat. This is simply unacceptable, Captain. If we are out of pâté, do we have any tuna cheek or foie gras?
Why are you looking at me like that, Lady Hood?
Are you or are you not going to light my ciggy? You can't expect a lady to light her own, surely.
Sorry. Don't have a lighter on me at the moment.
For the love of green roses... Officer!
Yes, Lady Hood? Why certainly, Lady Hood!
See, not that hard. Time to consider what accoutrements will adorn my cylindrical turrets.
To dazzle the enemy, right?
Beauty is pain, Captain. Speaking of a pain, it appears the Bitch Fleet is in our range.
@BATTLE
Do you have something in your eye, Lady Hood?
Of course not, Captain. I was hoping that you would notice my new mascara.
Well, yes, I do see that you're wearing mascara.
Mind you, this is not your mater's mascara. This is the new waterproof mascara from the renowned Helena Rubinstein. Waterproof mascara! Imagine that!
What does it do?
We are at sea, surrounded by the salty mist, and this mascara won't run! There is no risk of looking like those awful Morganas. Would you say my eyes look more doe-like?

Fields.MenuText: I like Elizabeth Arden better.
Your eyes do look larger.
Put that mascara away!

Fields.DialogueText: If you're trying to be clever, I'll remind you that she hasn't invented a mascara that is invaluable to our mission.
I'll take the compliment, Captain.
Yes, Captain. Wouldn't want nanny to send me to bed without any supper.
This focus on beauty is overwhelming at times.
Speaking of focus, I need to order a concave mirror for my vanity. The curve magnifies, so I can pluck my eyebrows a bit better.
Will that vanity ever be finished?
*ALARM*
It would progress faster without those dreadful Morganas mucking up the process.
@BATTLE
OW!! My toes!
Do try to be a bit more cautious, Captain. These boxes contain fragile souvenirs from my global expeditions.
So much for sympathy...
Captain, look this is a diamond necklace. Real diamonds, not glass from Sierra Leone. And these iridescent gems are opals from Australia. I'm very keen on them, as they match my eyes.
This ship is a beauty parade.
A bit of information: I have won several trophies, including the Hornby Cup. 1921 was a fond time to remember. It's expected of me to look my best. I can't let my people down.

Fields.MenuText: Winning battles won't let your people down.
I'm not sure what to say any more.
Where are your trophies now?

Fields.DialogueText: Being beautiful is half of the battle right there, Captain. If you have any doubt, then look no further than Fay Wray. Beauty is what killed the beast.
I'll take that as a compliment that you are too struck by my beauty for words.
They're displayed outside, for all the crew to see.
Maybe try to find a place for all these souvenirs, then?
*ALARM*
There's not going to be time for finding homes for my precious adornments if the Morganas don't stop this nonsense.
@BATTLE
What is this room?
This is the chapel, Captain. My ship's design was built around this very room. The intricate design on this altar is lovely, wouldn't you agree?
Why are you in the chapel? Is something the matter?
Nothing is wrong, Captain. I was getting my beauty rest in here. It's mostly quiet, except during service. Perfect to catch the forty winks.
I should have known.
Nothing keeps the skin as vibrant as a bit of divine intervention. The only other option is sick bay, but those beds are for those who need it.
That's news! You being charitable.
Most Lords and Ladies of gentry run charities, Captain. The ship is no different. Pop in for a quick peek in sick berth, it is the finest the Royal Navy has to offer.

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather not.
What's behind that altar there?
What other rooms are there?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps the seaman's mess hall then? We go through 300 lbs of tomatoes a day for breakfast.
It is where a lady keeps her secrets.
There's the school room.
Would you look at that. I must say I admire the tenacity of the Morganas. Shame though, they're not even a challenge for my grace.
@BATTLE
I like my private Commander's dining room better, thank you.
I do say, Captain! Someone has acquired tastes.
You mean makeup.
Your theatrics require some attention to detail, I'm afraid.
For briefings?
Or as a method to fall asleep when all the sheep have been accounted for.
Help me pick out these crystals for the water closet lighting, if you please, Captain.
This seems a bit extravagant.
If you wish to discuss extravagance, you have crystal lighting in your private dining room. I make appearances to greet people in the Seaman's mess.
Focusing the subject back on me.
If you have it, then flaunt it. I can't flaunt my beauty in a private dining hall. I need to be adored by those who are part of His Majesty's Ship.
*meow*
Ginger! It's time for din-din, is it? Let's go down to the mess and see if Cookie has some tuna for you.

Fields.MenuText: Who's Cookie?
If you need me, I'll be in my dining room.
Where is the other cat?

Fields.DialogueText: The ship's cook.
Your dining room would actually be the ideal size for my powder room. Consider it part of the charitable cause.
The other happy fellow, Fishcakes, is probably already at the mess, awaiting our arrival.
Enjoy your meal.
*ALARM*
Flaunting in front of the crew will have to be put on the backburner. I have Morganas to flaunt my teeth at.
@BATTLE
Captain! Over here, Captain! I need your opinion on this matter.
Well, here I am...
For the powder room, I am thinking about a large sum of string lights.
Like holiday lights?
They are similar. Back in 1935, I was framed in lights for the wedding of the Duke of Gloucester. I think some of the vanity would look good like that.
Hrmm...
I could also frame Aunty and Sammy in lights as well.
I think framing your pom-poms would make them targets to hit by your enemies.
My enemies? The Morganas are all of our enemies.

Fields.MenuText: You know what I mean!
How's that vanity progressing?
Did you find Fishcakes?

Fields.DialogueText: Proper reference is key to a compelling conversation.
It's progressing as one would expect. I should have set my eyes on the Captain's dining room.
Indeed, that fellow was waiting for Ginger and myself in the mess. On time, and as expected.
*ALARM*
Excellent! I was considering doing my daily calisthenics, but this will substitute in rather well.
@BATTLE
Captain! Have you received word if my new painter has come in?
Sorry. No civilian arrivals in the past twenty-four hours. This is a specialized painter of some sort, I take it?
Indeed! The majority of my renovations are finished, but details still must be accounted for. I'm bringing in this chap for the seaside Cornish chough mural.
Is that mural for the foyer or the water closet? I can't remember at this point.
That mural is for the water closet. A vibrant floral scene is going to be for the foyer. And, before you say anything about it, you have your own foyer into the captain's quarters.

Fields.MenuText: One more person won't matter by this point.
Maybe the painter can do the wardroom after he's finished.
What about painting the hull?

Fields.DialogueText: Right you are! I am the biggest ship in the Royal Navy, after all.
What a splendid idea! Don't make any plans without my approval.
Smashing idea, Captain! I want to look my best when I pull into port. A fresh coat of paint on the hull is what we need.
Looks like this painter is going to be more useful than I initially anticipated.
I will let you in on a best-kept secret. Beauty is a dynamic process. It changes as much as the tides.
That's a best-kept secret?
You'd be surprised how many people don't pay attention to these things. And I do hope you are at your best Captain, because the ship has company.
Morganas?
Right you are, Captain.
@BATTLE
Look how adorable this little port is! I think I need to have a seaman fetch me some rum. Seaman, I need a bottle of rum, and if you spot any rubber balls or ribbons, pick those up as well.
Rubber balls?
Indeed. Ginger and Fishcakes require some toys to keep them occupied.
Maybe they should focus on catching rats instead.
If you're concerned about the vermin problem, perhaps you should try hunting them yourself.
Who did you send into port?
One of the officers - and also the finest rower in Great Britain. I do love the sheer number of athletes aboard my ship; it gives me something nice to look at.

Fields.MenuText: Something nice to look at?
What's the rum for?
You sure do love those cats...

Fields.DialogueText: I do say, if one is going to be out at sea for extended periods of time, best to have your crew be athletes. Then I can take in a rugby or footie game.
I've had a craving for something dark and stormy on my palate as of late.
They're a part of me! And they're universally adored.
*ALARM*
All these Morganas will give me a wrinkle or a grey hair. Tell the crew to bare my teeth at them, the Bitch Fleet needs to be dealt with before I suffer any consequences.
@BATTLE
Hood, what are you doing?
I'm putting on my best face. I am going to pick out the crystal and wood trim and I don't want to see a shiny nose staring back at me.
You look fine.
Now, let's not be hasty. I am not finished getting ready yet.
By your own standards, you look spectacular enough for battle. I don't see why shopping for wood trim is any different.
If I intend to get the most exotic wood or flawless crystals, then I need to win the salesman over with my charm and good looks.
Because only the best will do.
Clever you are! You are learning, Captain. Now tell me, which shade of these stockings looks best, the darker or lighter shade?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know if I'm qualified to answer that question.
The darker shade to contrast and light your eyes.
The nude to show off those gams.

Fields.DialogueText: Then can you fetch me someone who is qualified? The cook should do just fine.
Good choice, Captain. It allows me to captivate and hold the salesman's attention.
Good choice, Captain! If you have it, flaunt it.
I love my new stockings, it is a shame that the nylon material is being allocated for the war effort. Being beautiful in battle is what matters most.
*ALARM*
Let's see this beauty in action.
Help me pick out an outfit that says "ready for battle."
@BATTLE
Now, where is...
Captain?
Captain! Let me bum a ciggy from you.

Fields.MenuText: Sure. Here, I'll even light it for you.
I don't smoke.
You know, I'm told smoking is bad for your health.

Fields.DialogueText: This seems all too unscrupulous, are you sure you're the same Captain?
Just a moment, then. Seaman! May the lady of the ship please borrow a ciggy?
Good or bad, it gives me something to do with the hand and looks rather elegant.
Good news, Captain. The renovations are nearly finished. All we are missing are a few details.
Are my ears deceiving me?
You heard right. I'm just missing a few key items. I need to take a trip to Clydebank, Scotland.
Isn't that your hometown?
On paper, but I can assure you, I am entirely English. I need to go to Clydebank to pick up the band.
A band?
For the fanfare! There's going to be a grand opening for the my washroom. The most beautiful washroom on the most beautiful ship in all of the British Empire.
*ALARM*
Dammit.
A mere annoyance. They're no match for my firepower.
@BATTLE
Of course. Well, you're in luck - we've been called back to the Norwegian patrols, so a stop at Clydebank is-
Look around, Captain! Isn't West Dunbartonshire stunning?
Hm.
It isn't hard to see where one gets her beauty from.

Fields.MenuText: The grass is extraordinarily green.
It's rainy and dreary.
Where is the band?

Fields.DialogueText: It's the same shade as that of an emerald, don't you think?
That's no way to speak of a lady's home.
Such a worrywort, Captain.
It turns out, the band is in another town entirely. We will pick them up later.
Then, what are we getting in Clydebank?
I decided to pick up some Scottish blackface sheep. They will look brilliant in the ceremony. Sheep parading down the deck to the tune of the band.
Confetti will be flying everywhere with the Union Jack flying high!
That will be... quite the spectacle.
As long as my grand opening isn't impeded by Morganas, or anyone else who cares not to have a good time, it will be.
What about rain?
The beauty of a good English rain is often underestimated. And, not to rain on your parade, but Morganas are closing in.
@BATTLE
*sheep are bleating*
Lady Hood! Is there any way to stop the noise?
It reminds me of the English countryside - the country manors peppered with sheep and horses.
Bugger, I should have gotten a horse to ride on.

Fields.MenuText: I think the sheep are more than enough.
That's not always the best idea. Just think of Lady Godiva.
Where would you stow a horse?

Fields.DialogueText: My hull can hold more than sheep. A joey was once my ship's mascot.
What is that supposed to signify?
At this moment, I haven't the faintest, but I suspect it might be the captain's quarters.
How many days is the ceremony again?
It will begin when we pull into that port, and continue for however long it pleases.
What do you think I should wear for the ceremony? I want something that speaks to my power and beauty.

Fields.MenuText: A short skirt would show off those gams.
Choose a gown, flowing and elegant.
I don't care, just don't go Lady Godiva on me.

Fields.DialogueText: If that's a compliment, I'll accept. You are right, flaunt what I have.
Should I go with satin gloves as well? Elbow or wrist length?
What are you implying?
*ALARM*
There they are again, trying to put the damper on my plans.
@BATTLE
"Some of the Belles are extremely spirited," the Admiral said. "Give her room to express herself," the Admiral said. Now everything smells like wet sheep.
I've heeded your advice, Captain, the hull was given a fresh coat. I need to look my best for the celebration.
A normal color, I hope?
I'd only used the colors that everyone has come to associate with my ship. I used the traditional palette, if you're curious.
The traditional grayscale ship colors. That seems... not fashionable?
Who are you to question fashion? These colors are recognizable by everyone. How can I be adorned if no one is able to recognize me?
Fashion isn't always about making a statement, it is also about branding and being recognized. Someone with my reputation needs to be recognized.
All right, all right. Where is our next stop?
Our next stop is to drop off the painter and architect and their respective crews. From there, it's to our next destination and then... the celebration!

Fields.MenuText: Don't forget the band!
How many people are attending?
What food is being served?

Fields.DialogueText: We are meeting the band at our destination port now. I do hope they show up this time around.
Several hundreds, probably more. That's precisely why I need to look my best.
Whatever Cookie decides to make or order from a nearby restaurant. The food can't take the focus away from me, however.
*ALARM*
If it hasn't already been said yet, the Morganas are far more of a nuisance that perhaps anyone has expected them to be. I better not break a nail.
@BATTLE
Hood! The floor is covered in hay.
That's Lady Hood, if you please. I don't have any hay on board, the sheep are on fine straw bedding. I don't want anything sticking to their wool.
What are the sheep eating?
Dried grass from Dunbartonshire, I have it stored in the larder. The vitamins in fresh grass are far more beneficial to the complexion.
You're worried about the complexions of the sheep now?
We must all look our best for the ceremony, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Stow those sheep elsewhere.
What should I wear?
Don't get attached to the sheep.

Fields.DialogueText: Your attitude will not reflect well on the ship. People can't adore sour.
This might be too much of a challenge, even for the Mighty Hood. Perhaps wear something that says “Captain,” but is festive as well.
I already have the seamen taking bets on what names should be picked. I will be drawing the names prior to the grand opening celebration.
What are we going to do about this hay?
Straw, Captain. As I stated earlier, it is straw.
My apologies. Please answer the question.
The hay will be swept off the deck and into the sea once the sheep leave.
*ALARM*
I wonder if Morganas like straw? Doubtful. It's too good for their kind.
@BATTLE
It's almost time! Where are the ribbons for Ginger and Fishcakes?
Do you mean their toys or decorations?
The accoutrement variety. They are little Union Jack ribbons. Officer!
Yes, Lady Hood?
I am frightfully busy with party planning, but If you see the ship's cats, please put these Union Jack ribbons around their necks, would you?
With pleasure, Lady Hood.
Thank you, Officer. Now that's something I never tire of hearing... “with pleasure.”

Fields.MenuText: You do love being the center of attention.
What are the sheep going to wear?
When would you not like being the center of attention?

Fields.DialogueText: It's all in due course for the most beautiful and beloved ship in the Royal Navy.
The sheep are wearing banners from John Brown & Company. A shearer is giving the sheep a bath now. I want that white wool to look its finest.
I don't understand the question, and I won't respond to it.
It seems like the debut for the washroom is at hand.
No, no, it can't be! I nearly forgot my paper machè chough! It's a float I'm going to ride in on... how would anyone know to focus on me without it?
I thought the focus of the parade was your new washroom.
Myself and my new washroom. Now, if you'll excuse me, my people are waiting for me.
*ALARM*
Drat! Those Morganas...
@BATTLE
Lady Hood, stop dancing around for a minute!
Cue the fountains! Start the ticker tape! It is time to reveal the new washroom in due pomp and circumstance! Open the doors!
I have pressing news...
More pressing than what brand of heels I am wearing?

Fields.MenuText: I don't even know any heel brands.
Do those heels even match?
Yes. You'd better brace yourself...

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever the brand is going to be, I need it to match my Prada clutch. The finest leather from Milan.
Don't be absurd, Captain.
If you're trying to be frank, it is frankly quite terrible.
Stop. You need to hear this.
Okay, well, get on with it. What news is it you speak of?
Due to unforeseen circumstances the band... I'll be frank, there is no band.
Brace me, Captain, I'm about to faint!
I didn't mean for it to be that detrimental.
Whatever shall we do? The band was crucial to the celebration!
Why don't you just continue on without a band?
That's an absurdity! No, I will have the crew sing, acapella. God Save the King. It's patriotic enough. The spectators will enjoy it.
That works, I guess.
In fact, everyone might join in as I come in on my chough float. Out of my way, Captain, I have preparations to attend to!
*ALARM*
Morganas? They better stand out of my way!
@BATTLE
Oh, ooohhh... it's all for me grog... me jolly, jolly grog...
Lady Hood, where are you? Are you in your washroom?
It's all gone for beer and... AHHHH!
AHH!
Try knocking, Captain!
What's on your face!
This is only the best cold cream science has to offer. It's good for when one indulges a bit too much on the libations. I need it to reduce swelling.
Swelling?
The puffiness around the eyes a hangover can cause. Nothing a bit of this cold cream can't cure.

Fields.MenuText: That was a wild parade, Hood. Can't say the crowd didn't adore you.
There are a lot of fine details in this washroom.
Here, lie down on this powder room couch.

Fields.DialogueText: It's what I was planning on, even before I started the water closet. Really though, the old washroom simply wouldn't do.
No expense was spared. The King himself would grace this washroom with his presence.
Oh, Captain, look, I preemptively had a couch installed next to that washroom stall for this very situation.

Fields.MenuText: Let's just sit for a while. The atmosphere is here is really quite nice.
I'll let you sleep the party off - but tomorrow that mess on deck needs to be the center of attention.

Fields.DialogueText: Uh-huh.
